topic.title: FlexO Frame Layer Features

body.p: LINEOTN supports the following FlexO frame layer features:

li.p: Supports up to six FlexO slice streams.

The receive direction supports descrambling of the FEC corrected stream (G.798 16.8), checks FlexO OH CRC (G.798 15.2.1), extracts all overhead to the OHP port including FCC, (G.798 15.3.2), and OSMC. The receive direction detects the following detects: AI_TSF, dLOFLANE, dLOL, dRDI, dLOM, and dLOFLOM. These defects, along with the software detected dGIDM and dPMM defects, are also propagated to the ring control port (RCP). An acceptance process is applied to the following fields: GID, PID, PHY_MAP, AVAIL, and the CRC protected subset of the RES field. The accepted field values are made available via registers. The receive direction also indicates the location of the ingress frame and multiframe boundaries on the OTN_FP interface for use in PTP timestamping.

The transmit direction supports the insertion of FlexO overhead fields STAT, AVAIL, PID, GID, and PHY MAP fields (G.798 15.3.1) from registers or the OHP port, insertion of FCC from the OHP port (G.798 15.3.2), insertion of FlexO OH CRC (G.798 15.2.1) calculated internally or from the OHP port, and insertion of OSMC from the OHP port. The transmit direction also indicates the location of the egress frame and multiframe boundaries on the OTN_FP interface for use in PTP timestamping.
For simplicity of testing and Applications support, the frame boundaries of FlexO members belonging to a common FlexO group may be aligned.
